extendedInfo.description: Outlook Android USB sync app suite for Contacts, Calendar, Tasks, Notes, Journal, Categories, Reminders, and Contact Photos. Choose from secure USB sync or DejaCloud sync for standalone Outlook, Lotus Notes, Sage ACT!, Palm Desktop and other CRM software. Works with CompanionLink PC or Mac software sold separately starting at $14.95. Free phone support and money-back guarantee included.CompanionLink (PC): http://www.companionlink.com/androidâ¨CompanionLink (Mac): http://www.companionlink.com/macDejaOffice is the only Outlook sync solution that gives you:â¢ Contacts, Calendar, Tasks, Notes and Journal in one business-class appâ¢ Option to choose Cloud or USB Connect for syncâ¢ Built to mirror Outlook data fields and look-n-feelâ¨â¢ One-click option to keep personal and business data separateâ¢ Full database encryption on Androidâ¢ Free phone support for lifeChoose from USB Connect or Cloud to sync Outlook with Android. Works with standalone Microsoft Outlook (no Exchange required, though we also support Exchange public folders).DejaOffice synchronizes with popular CRM and PIM software like Microsoft Outlook, Lotus Notes, Sage ACT!, Palm Desktop, Salesforce CRM, Zoho CRM, SugarCRM, GroupWise, GoldMine, Highrise, and Time and Chaos.What people say about DejaOffice:âFirst Outlook sync product that worked correctly out of the box.â (Reuben G)âAfter 15 days of fussing with other products, Iâve come home to CompanionLink.â (Herb D)âBest app Iâve ever downloaded. Professional, easy to use, intuitive.â (Eddie S)DejaOffice is mentioned on CNBC, AndroidCentral, AndroidForums, DroidForums, SkyMall and many other places!â¨====================â¨Featuresâ¨====================Smartphones arenât very smart when it comes to business functionality. DejaOffice changes that by adding business features similar to BlackBerry and Palm Treo. From color-coded categories, linking contacts to appointments and tasks, advanced view, sort and search options, DejaOffice gives you business features not found in Android devices.â¢ Holds more than 50,000 recordsâ¨â¢ Built to mirror Outlook contacts, Outlook calendar, Outlook tasks, and Outlook notesâ¨â¢ Advanced contacts sort (first name, last name, company name, categories) â¨â¢ Category manager with colorsâ¨â¢ 5 calendar views (day, week, month, year, list) â¨â¢ Multiple task styles (GTD, Franklin Covey, TBYL, Outlook-style, Palm-style) â¨â¢ Daily agenda widget (your appointments and tasks in one view)â¨â¢ Calendar and task alarms â¨â¢ Set advanced calendar recurrence patternsâ¨â¢ Link contacts to calendar events â¨â¢ Group contacts by city, company, postal codeâ¨â¢ Private records (password-protected) â¨â¢ Custom fields â¨â¢ Contact photos â¨â¢ Global search across all CRM data â¨â¢ Full database encryption â¨â¢ History log for every contact recordâ¨+ Selectable font sizes â¨â¢ Guided wizard for quick setup â¨â¢ Set Android home screen shortcuts to individual DejaOffice apps â¢ Dual-pane viewing options for Android Tablets. Better productivity and optimal use of screen space.â¨â¢ Integrates with built-in Android Contacts, Calendar, Dialer, Maps, Email, SMS, Browserâ¨â¢ Language options: English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Czech, Japanese, Korean, Chinese (China) and Chinese (Taiwan).â¨â¢ Works with all Android devices including Galaxy series, DROID series, HTC, LG, Huawei, Sony and others

reviews.title: Easy usability
reviews.comment: This has been an excellent product to link up my outlook to my android. From setup to use ability: it was effortless. There was even a 14 day trial that allowed me to have full functioning capability. I have not been disappointed.
reviews.author: Marianne Goldweber

reviews.title: Great but
reviews.comment: It would be nice to have a setting in calendar to autofill the adress of the contact, when I create an event from that contact. I really need this feature, as I visit my clients at theirs home.
reviews.author: manuel m.

reviews.title: This is the most frustrating app ever made.
reviews.comment: Your data will get put in funny places, trial and error is the only way to figure it out. If you let it sync your contacts to your Android phone book, your phone will turn to a slow series of crashes that can only be fixed with a factory reset. I could deal with all that, because I only made the mistakes once. Learn to deal and get on. But every time Android does a big  update the app locks up and will not sync. That days notes gone. Further more uninstalling and reinstalling will not work. Factory reset...
reviews.author: Adam Gerstbauer

reviews.title: Just don\'t! Find something else - Just don\'t get this software
reviews.comment: I installed this on my phone and purchased the $50.00 software that I installed on my work and home computers.  I sync my phone with my work computer and then back it up at home.  Everything is set so that my work PC is the primary and basically everything goes downward from there to minimize duplications etc.  Well, This FABULOUS software has now basically taken all 600+ of my contacts, thrown them up in the air and left information wherever it wants.  I have addresses where I had no address before.  I have phone number that have been moved.  I have notes that have been copied across numerous contacts.  Short, it is an absolute nightmare.  To make things better I attempted to email customer service.  5 days later and NO response.  Shocker!!  I have to say thanks to DejaOffice and Companionlink for completely destroying a contact list and tons of information that has taken years to buidl.  Stay away.
reviews.author: Glenn Hartley

reviews.title: Well! Things are not so great anymore
reviews.comment: Update 13-0822 I will caution people syncing to google and ACT Pro2013, whereas Google is the center. I now have lost contacts, lost numbers. Trying to figure it out.
reviews.author: Doug Ruggles

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.comment: Duplicates when syncing tend to plague this app. Been a power user for over three years. Still a problem.
reviews.author: Stewart Kreun

reviews.title: Great App
reviews.comment: Deja office helps me stay synched with my Outlook calendar appointments and contact details.
reviews.author: Ehsan Tarar

reviews.title: Excellent app. Using Droid RAZR Max.
reviews.comment: I use this app all the time. I prefer it over the default calendar and default contacts from Google. Only problem is I have a desktop dock that I connect over night. The dock has the capability of displaying the next days appointments, etc., but it only recognizes the default Google calendar and I can\'t figure out how to sync Deja Calendar with the Google calendar. If I could do that  then the app would be perfect.
reviews.author: Richard Holmes

reviews.comment: Better but needs fixes
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Use to be good
reviews.comment: Everything is ok but the notification alarm is always mistake from the original file!! Please fix this problem.
reviews.author: sasithorn assarasakorn

reviews.title: Wow
reviews.comment: This program sounds awesome except for the part where is keeps going unresponsive.
reviews.author: Avory Moore

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: Exactly what I was looking for. Robust features. I can\'t believe it\'s all for free.
reviews.author: Mylene Cheung

reviews.comment: Love this app
reviews.author: bill conroy

reviews.title: Doesn\'t remount
reviews.comment: Come on. It is a beta program again! Doesn\'t mount the SD card after sync. Updates often generate new problems. Don\'t gamble with our data!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Oh to have Palm again.
reviews.comment: Wait! DejaOffice is that and more! I\'ve been using a Palm device since the US Robotics days and just couldn\'t find a good mobile/computer replacement until now. My Samsung Galaxy s4, CompanionLink with DejaOffice is a peerfect match.  I\'m in my fourth month of daily use and have not had any issues.
reviews.author: L A Barriere

reviews.title: Horrible!  Constant crashing.
reviews.comment: I imported over 700 contacts from my Google contacts native phone app & everytime I open any contact it crashes.
reviews.author: Luis Gutierrez

reviews.title: Some good bits but randomly deletes diary entries
reviews.comment: Whilst this mostly does what it says on the tin, beware this software randomly deletes diary entries when syncing to my Galaxy S2.  This is a long running (year +) problem and I can no longer rely on it. The workarounds from the vendor are pretty lame -- look in Outlook deleted items for what it has dumped, put them back, and re-sync, but that\'s not the end as it refuses to read the restored entries.  The second workaround is to then force deletion of everything on my Galaxy S2 at the next sync, and then check again in the Outlook deleted items. If you get the idea this never ends -- you\'ve got it! Impressed -- not.
reviews.author: Philip Duke

reviews.title: Worth the small effort and price
reviews.comment: About three years ago I tried Companionlink Express to sync up my Droid 2 smartphone with Outlook and Act!. It failed in such a fantastic and miserable way I swore I would never look at it again. However, now, with my Droid 4, Outlook and Act!, this latest version of Companionlink Express is working perfectly. And it set up without a hitch.
reviews.author: Rev Louie Louie

reviews.title: Unreliable
reviews.comment: It is junk. been trying to get it to work for about 2 years. Tech support never solve the problems. they consistently give the runaround. the program is very unreliable and this is using it as a 1 way sync from my computer to my phone. it has and always have had major issues. The very bad thing is that no one else offers a solution that\'s better. this is the best software out there for us ACT power users that need to get contacts and field data to our smartphone. I\'m stuck between a rock and a hard spot.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Losing Records
reviews.comment: In order to sync DO with MS Office you must use CompanionLink on your PC.  For several years I have suffered intermittent loss of records (mostly contacts.). I have had to go through time consuming \'fixes\', mostly per CL support, which never solved the problems.  I still find records on my phone that are missing from my PC and CL just tells me that it is a problem with MS.  I\'ll be dropping both DO and CL soon.
reviews.author: Runyon Borofsky
